item.title: Report I-2023090093
item.description:
Report I-2023090093

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: Auburn
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSSI MOTOR FREIGHT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FORKLIFT OPERATOR WAS LOADING A WOODEN PALLET OF 32 HM JUGS AND CAUGHT/PUNCTURED- 1 OF 32 HM JUGS WITH HIS FORKLIFT FORKS. THE FORKLIFT OPERATOR BACKED OUT OF THE TRAILER AND NOTIFIED A SUPERVISOR TO WHAT HAD HAPPENED. THE FORKLIFT OPERATOR WAS DIRECTED AFTER REVIEW OF THE ERG BOOK TO CONTAIN THE SPILL USING EYE PROTECTION, GLOVES AND ABSORBANT MATERIAL, THEN PLACE THE CLEANUP MATERIAL AND DEBRIS INTO A CONTAINMENT DRUM FOR DISPOSAL TO NE DISPOSAL TECHNOLOGY.

item.title: Report X-2023081622
item.description:
Report X-2023081622

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: NATICK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded this morning and the package handler noticed the box wet, they immediately notified a manger who placed the damage hazmat in a red bin. The hazmat was then taken to the hazmat cage with the vent on. DescribePack: The hazmat was packed inside a box too big for the hazmat with only bubble wrap. The bubble wrap was not securely over the hazmat allowing the hazmat to slip out of the bubble wrap and the hazmat was being shipped loose inside the box inadequate for its size. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a red hazmat bin brought to the hazmat cage with the ventilation system on.
